title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message:
The device was booting but works normally after bootup. Didn't find any abnormal activity in the monitor.  Sometimes crashed with a kernel panic. 
- On the MLB found corrosion behind CPU (image attached)
- Cleaned up, still behaving same
- Attaching the crash report.

Please help me with the next steps.

title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message:
Clean the corrosion and replace any affected components.
There could be accumulated crap underneath PCH.
Heat it with quality flux.

Remove internal SSD and test the machine with USB macOS.

title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message: All the above options were tried, no go.

title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message: Try known good BIOS, with clean ME region.

title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78765, member: 682"]
Try known good BIOS, with clean ME region.
[/QUOTE]
Could you please direct me to a thread that explains what that is an how to do it? I have no idea what that means.

Thanks!

title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message: Please, do not use threads from other members in this manner...

title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message:
[USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] Thanks for the help.

Yes, it was a BIOS issue. After trying 2-3 ICs from the doner board, one worked. Later, I reprogrammed it with the right serial number.

Small issue: The keyboard backlight is not working, could that be because of BIOS?
- working fine at OS level, no ? sign.

title: 820-0165 MBA A1466 2015 - Slow boot up and Kernel Panic
message:
If you change serial number, must fix Fsys checksum.
Also need to clean ME region.
All can be done with UEFITool; check the forum, or youtube.

The backlight keyboard issue should not be related with BIOS.
Test disconnecting webcam.
